mapper.select: select * from (select rownum r_num, a.* from (select ma.mailnum, me1.memname mailsname, me2.memname mailrname, ma.mailtitle, ma.maildate from member me1, member me2, mail ma where (me1.memnum=ma.mailmem and me2.meminmail=ma.mailreceiver) and ((ma.mailmem=#{usernum} and ma.mailsdelete=2) or (ma.mailreceiver=#{userid} and ma.mailrdelete=2)) order by ma.maildate desc) a) where r_num between #{begin} and #{end}

select ma.mailtitle, me1.memname mailsname, me2.memname mailrname, ma.maildate, ma.mailcont, ma.mailfile, me1.meminmail replyid, ma.mailreceiver from mail ma, member me1, member me2 where me1.memnum=ma.mailmem and me2.meminmail=ma.mailreceiver and ma.mailnum=#{mailnum}
select mailmem,mailreceiver from mail where mailnum=#{num}
mapper.update: update mail set mailsdelete=#{delvalue} where mailnum=#{mailnum}
update mail set mailrdelete=#{delvalue} where mailnum=#{mailnum}
mapper.select: select (select count(*) from mail where mailreceiver=#{userid} and mailrdelete=1 and not mailmem=#{usernum}) fromnum, (select count(*) from mail where mailmem=#{usernum} and mailsdelete=1 and not mailreceiver=#{userid}) tonum, (select count(*) from mail where mailmem=#{usernum} and mailreceiver=#{userid} and mailsdelete=1 and mailrdelete=1) mynum, (select count(*) from mail where (mailmem=#{usernum} and mailsdelete=2) or (mailreceiver=#{userid} and mailrdelete=2)) trashnum from dual
